Description: Fragment of a small pottery open vessel (kantharos or cup-kantharos?); low, profiled, flaring ring foot; black glaze on outside with a red stripe in concave part; only small part of black-glazed interior with stamped (palmettes) decoration is preserved; black glaze on underside of foot, with graffito. Hard, light orange clay.
Curator's comments: Attic glazed ware is not known to have been found in Dafana. It is possible that this fragment came from Tell Dafana in the Ptolemaic Period.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 352)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.129, p.226, pl.68)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
